Package muscle.core.conduit.filter

Interface Summary
Filter<E> interface for conduit filters
WrapperFilter<E extends DataWrapper> interface for conduit filters which act on wrapped data
 

Class Summary
AbstractFilter<E>  
BlockAfterTimeFilter ignores data after a given timestep, only recommended for debugging purposes
ConsoleWriterFilter this filter writes data to standard out and also forwards the data to the next filter
DeserializeFilter deserialize a byte array
DropFilter drops data if incoming time scale is not a multiple of outgoing dt, newInDt is only required to build the corresponding DataTemplate for incomming data use for testing, usually better try to not send the dropped data at all from within the CA
FilterChain the inner filter mechanism of a conduit
LinearInterpolationFilterDouble interpolates two adjacent values of the incoming data array for this filter to work, the incomming data must have one value more than the outgoing data
LinearTimeInterpolationFilterDouble interpolates between current and last timestep
maps coarse time scale to fine time scale, where dt_coarse = 2*dt_fine dt_coarse-dt_fine must be equal to dt_coarse/2
remember: the count of overall calculated coarse dts should be half as many as calculated fine dts otherwise this filter can not provide data for the last timestep
dtCoarseCount = (globalStepCount%dt_coarse)-1
dtFineCount = (globalStepCount%dt_fine)-1
dtCoarseCount/2 == dtFineCount
0   1   2   3 t_coarse
|  /|  /|  /|
| | | | | | |
0 1 2 3 4 5 6 t_fine
MultiplyFilterDouble multiplies every value of incomming data with a constant factor
NullFilter this filter does nothing, data passed to this filter is lost
PipeFilter this filter simply forwards the data to the next filter without altering the data
ProgressFilter forwards the data to the next filter without altering the data, but allows the user to pause the message passing via a GUI
ReproduceFilterDouble duplicates input data of a coarse delta t and reproduces this data multiple times for a fine time scale
SerializeFilter<E extends Serializable> serialize to a byte array
ThreeD2TwoDFilterDouble maps 3d grid data to 2d data (calculates the average value for the third dimension)
TimeFactorFilter modifies timestep with a given factor
TimeOffsetFilter modifies timestep with a given offset
WrapperFilterHead entry point for a filter chain used within conduits
WrapperFilterTail exit of a filter chain used within conduits
